args:
The soldiers found their quarry: A dragon known
as the Master of the Sea. But the beast was in
a foul mood, and when the soldiers appealed to
it, it forced them to dance on the beach until
their deaths. Mikoto and Patia then hurry out
to put a stop to it and save their vacation.

After a day spent competing with the imperial
soldiers who attacked the beach in search of a
much-needed vacation, Patia and Mikoto
considered their defense a rousing success.
But they soon began to suspect the soldiers were\nengaged in nefarious business! Perhaps the beach\nis not as safe as they once thought...

So, we left guarding the beach to His
Highness and followed the soldiers' tracks
here, but this is where they end.
Do you think they sussed out our tail?
Blast. If we don't find a way to put a stop\nto these scoundrels, I fear something\nterrible is going to happen.
If you wish to continue your pursuit,\nlet us seek a sign.
And how will we do that, exactly?
We merely enter a meditative state\nand become one with nature.
...Okay, my eyes are shut. Now what?
Now you must isolate any disturbances\nin the natural order.
You could be a little more clear.
Once you find such a disturbance,\nnature will simply tell you the rest.\n...Ah, yes. They went that way.
This seems like something where you need\nto achieve enlightenment before it works.\nHow did you learn to do it?

I meditated for three years at the roots of
an 800-year old ash tree until I attained
divine revelation. This ability arrived
naturally during that time.
Enough. It is time to turn our attentions\naway from our own conversation and\ntoward that of our foes.
This is the only spot we haven't checked\nfor the beast, so I sure hope it's here.
Me too! We've knocked every single other\n＂optional objective＂ off the stupid list,\nand I'm ready for this to be over.
Right? Talk about your pains in the rear.\n...All right, Master of the Sea! Get out\nhere so we can all go home already!

What do you think this dragon will be like?
I mean, considering that it can grant
dominion over an area that stretches
as far as the eye can see.
I'm not familiar with the\n＂Master of the Sea.＂
From what I can gather, it seems to be\nthe guardian dragon of these parts.
The whole ＂granting dominion＂ bit\nstrikes me as a bit overdramatic.
Powerful dragons aren't usually in the\nbusiness of helping random humans.\nIs this thing even real?
It is—though it may not be as powerful\nas normal at the moment, since it is\nmost likely wounded.
How could you possibly know that?

Before I washed up here, I was locked
in a battle to the death with a being of
incredible power. I believe that creature
was the Master of the Sea.
The thing that smashed your surfboard?
I recall the beast saying something about\ngranting the power to realize my wish.
But I wanted to achieve this wish by my\nown hand, and so refused. Let us just say\nthe beast did not take my rejection kindly.
Had I known what was going to transpire,\nit might have been better to accept its\npower to help in my search for Mineuchi.
I wouldn't be so sure the power it was\noffering is useful for finding cats,\nbut please go on.

Even for one such as I who has attained
enlightenment, the beast proved a
mighty foe. Those imperial soldiers
will be no match for it.
Whatever the Empire's intentions,\nit is dangerous to allow them to\nmake contact with such a being.

You may be right. But at this point,
we don't even know if they're GOING
to find it. For now, we should probably
just hold back and keep our eyes open.
So this dragon nests in that cave, yeah?
That's what the latest intel claims.\nI sure hope it's right, since we spent our\nwhole summer looking for the damn thing.
Then let's go in there, talk to it,\nand be done with this thing already!
Holy crap! It's the Master of the Sea!
It appears they have found it.
This is no time for your deadpan\nobservations. We have to stop them!
Grant us our wish, O Master of the Sea!\nGive us the power to dominate the ocean!
Oh, and if you don't grant us the power\nwe'll just take it from you!
As I find your TRUE wish quite interesting,\nI shall grant you my power. However...

I am in an extraordinarily foul mood at the
moment. So until I am satisfied, you will
fulfill your dream by dancing forever
on the beach you yearn for so deeply.
They vanished! Did you understand any of\nthat, Mikoto? The dragon said something\nabout a beach, right?

I imagine it was a result of the ＂true wish＂
that was mentioned. It seems dominion
over the sea was not actually what these
soldiers desired above all else.
Of course! Their bosses want dominion,\nbut THEY just want a vacation!
Yes. And as the dragon was feeling surly,\nit sent the soldiers to vacation on a beach\nuntil the cold hand of death claims them.
I do not imagine that is the sort of\nvacation the soldiers had in mind.

Your capacity for understatement is
positively breathtaking. The dragon said
it would make them dance forever, but
there's only so much a body can take.
PLUS, this is going to completely ruin\nthe beach we fought so hard to protect!
It is fortunate we are here, for this may\nnot be the outcome Heaven desires.
Then let's hurry back to Lathom Beach,\nand fight to save everyone's vacation!
